title: Laptop advice
content:
Hi everyone! 
I'm currently using this laptop which is 4yrs old: https://amzn.in/d/720MD5G 
I'm wondering if it would be sufficient for the rest of my engineering course. Would it handle the necessary tasks, or should I consider an upgrade?

comments.body: I feel it’ll do okay. Not gonna do any wonders, but should manage to push through most things.
I tried running a VM but it was really slow and laggy

That’s what I meant by just pushing through most things. VM’s are a little heavy and things like that probably won’t be as smooth. Atleast in my experience, we didn’t really need VMs unless you got into the network/security spec so most things should run fine till then. If needed, you could upgrade then. 

Or if you have funds at the moment, you could go ahead and upgrade right away! If you want VM’s make sure you get something with a higher number of cores and more than average RAM
Ig this should do the trick, but if u have money to spend and if u are looking upgrade build a pc, it's way more cost effective. Ik it's not portable but it gives u a lot more power

cpu is good, upgrade the ram and storage, or if you cant afford the upgrades then switch to linux and be a little careful on disk usage, 256gb is usually not enough, keep pen drives and backup important shit

cpu is good, upgrade the ram and storage, or if you cant afford the upgrades then switch to linux and be a little careful on disk usage, 256gb is usually not enough, keep pen drives and backup your files regularly to make sure your disk wont fill up

if your computer boots up, its sufficient 

all other things can be figured out later
I'm actually a beginner in Linux and was running a VM to practice and get more hands-on experience. Thanks a lot for the advice tho
